note:
Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework used for building user interfaces. It is known for being lightweight, easy to learn, and incrementally adoptable, meaning you can use it to power a single button or to build a full-scale single-page application.
Key features

Reactivity: Vue automatically tracks and updates the HTML when your JavaScript data changes. This is known as "two-way data binding," which simplifies keeping your data and the user interface in sync.
Component-based architecture: Vue allows you to break down your application into small, reusable building blocks called components. Each component contains its own HTML template, logic, and styling.

Approachability: It is often considered a great choice for beginners due to its detailed documentation and simple syntax, which is based on standard HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.Flexibility
You can use Vue in a variety of ways depending on your needs:
Progressive enhancement: Drop it into existing HTML pages to add interactivity.
Single-Page Application (SPA): Build a complex, full-featured application with advanced tooling.

Single-Page Application (SPA): Build a complex, full-featured application with advanced tooling.
